org.ensembl.util
Class FrequencyCounter

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap
      java.util.HashMap
          org.ensembl.util.FrequencyCounter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map, java.io.Serializable
public class FrequencyCounter
extends java.util.HashMap

Convenience class that can be used to count the number of times a key is added.

Author:
Craig Melsopp
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
FrequencyCounter()
           
FrequencyCounter(int initialCapacity, float loadFactor)
           
 
Method Summary
 void addOrIncrement(java.lang.Object key)
          If object is not currently a key in the map it is added as a key pointing to a Counter instance with a value of 1.
 void addOrIncrementAll(java.util.List list)
          Calls addOrIncrement(Object) for each item in list.
 int getCount(java.lang.Object o)
          Number of times _o_ has been added to this frequency counter.
 java.lang.Object getMostFrequent()
          Returns the most frequently added key.

Method Detail

addOrIncrement

public void addOrIncrement(java.lang.Object key)
If object is not currently a key in the map it is added as a key pointing to a Counter instance with a value of 1.

Parameters:
key - key to be added or to have it's Counter incremented.
See Also:
Counter

getMostFrequent

public java.lang.Object getMostFrequent()
Returns the most frequently added key. If two or more keys have been added the same (most) number of times then any of these could be returned.

Returns:
most frequent key or null if none in map.

getCount

public int getCount(java.lang.Object o)
Number of times _o_ has been added to this frequency counter.

Parameters:
o - object.
Returns:
frequency that object occured, or 0 if unkown object.

addOrIncrementAll

public void addOrIncrementAll(java.util.List list)
Calls addOrIncrement(Object) for each item in list.

Parameters:
list - zero or more objects to be added to counter.
